comments.text:
Nope not tired of movies like this. Tired of people with the white guilt 
agenda? Sure of coarse its played out and then some. "Specially in School". 
So trendy. Tired of every forum being coated with liberal agenda's and anti 
white semitism? of coarse its played into the ground. Hollywood is much 
more interesting then every forum on the web being turned into a anti 
white, anti american, or muslim vs west topic. That imo is much more dull 
and over played. I usually notice the same people that are always 
complaining about these same topics are the same people that go out of 
there way to show everyone how opened minded they are. Extreme irony? Are 
you able to enjoy good things around you? or are you to far lost in your 
white vs x racism? Anyways. Movies great. Dont feel guilty for saying that 
or for being white.

comments.text:
+Beyond The Trailer
Yes, and that always seems to be the defense against criticism about this 
genre.  Most of these white savior movies are "based on a true story," so 
how can anyone complain about them, right?  But there are millions of 
amazing, true stories out there about non-white people who don't have to 
rely on a white savior.  It's very disappointing (and maybe a little 
telling) that the ones they want to tell, over and over again, are these 
white savior narratives.

I don't see a lot of Mexican American movies out there these days but I 
still wonder why the book "Esperanza Rising" was never made into a movie. 
That book came out so long ago and won an award I remember reading it as a 
kid thinking it would be a great movie and it is centered around Mexicans 
who go from riches to rags to riches. Really great story. Hope Hollywood 
eventually adapts it to a film.﻿

comments.author: getfitafter50

comments.text:
+Tereese DeMetz I know you wish you were that profound, Tereese, but the 
reality of your situation is that, despite your delusions of grandeur, you 
fall into a category of a helluva lot of other people whose self-importance 
will always override ACTUAL social issues being faced in this country and 
abroad. When you are able to eventually manage a decent, *honest* 
conversation about the continuing effects, small and large, of colonialism, 
white supremacy, and white privilege w/o getting offended and totally in 
your own head, then you'll start to stand apart. Until then, try not to 
strike meaningless dialogue on forums such as Youtube to assuage your white 
guilt. 

Your life has nothing to do w/me, and I shouldn't have to understand where 
you're "coming from" for you to get the basics of the white savior complex 
that has always been rampant in Hollywood.
comments.author: mwarnsle

comments.author: getfitafter50

comments.text:
+mwarnsle No shallow Tereese didn't see American Sniper - the trailer was 
more than enough for me and I helped someone on an Army Base once - got to 
live there, but was never in the military.  Saw enough to wish the men and 
women serving in any war would have never been subjected to the terror we 
can ALL heap on ourselves not just in war, but in racist attitudes; in 
moral wrecking decisions; in the bad/sad attitudes people choose and in the 
power mongering some people mistakenly use because they have delusions of 
Godhead.  It is a really difficult job to stay on a sane and hope filled 
road - especially when there are all kinds of people, places, events and 
things to more than make a person wreck.  HOWEVER mwarnsle - some of us 
have to do it - and I don't think people like you will ever understand 
people like me.

+mwarnsle Its a good story no matter what = your "whitey lead" comment  is

comments.author: Tereese DeMetz

comments.text:
+manilexis17 as seeing it BEFOREhand defeats the entire purpose of taking a 
stand, I'm afraid I'll have to pass. I don't doubt it may be good, so I 
think you missed the point. When audiences show up to a movie with a bunch 
of minorities with a white lead, it tells studios that audiences can only 
stand minorities in film when white people are leading. There are literally 
hundreds of untold stories that would make great movies, as well, but 
studios are afraid to market for fear of it being seen as a "minority 
movie". Look no further than Sony's leaked emails about the Equalizer. 

I'll see Costner in Black and White coming out, b/c he shares the spotlight 
with his minority castmates and the message appears positive without being 
patronizing or cliche. Enjoy your screenings!
comments.author: mwarnsle

comments.text:
This movie is really good and coach white didn't save anybody he just 
helped out when no one was helping how about you go see the movie when it 
comes out before you try to pass judgment on it. This movie was one of the 
best that I've seen and I don't like movies like this its funny and it's 
original and it's a true story they stuck to the actual story and didn't 
over dramatize it. This is worthy for an award win. And I saw it already 
because I work screenings. And this one was screened for the PR's. But 
trust me this movie is outstanding

comments.text: yes and it was based on a true story , im glad you watched it
comments.author: Joyce M

comments.text:
+Johnny Hernandez
Agreed, it was predictable. But it was also a testament to the strength of 
believing in yourself.

The central valley is hot, dry, dusty and filled with many little towns 
where countless nameless / faceless 'invisible people' do back breaking, 
soul breaking work and without which, we'd not have the food on our tables. 
McFarland, Buttonwillow, Pumpkin Center, Weed Patch, Delano .........

So maybe, despite its predictability, it will help people realize that 
there's so much more to life than just taking things for granted.
comments.author: Nia the Gulf Gypsy

comments.text:
I did watch it and I loved it. However like you said it was way too 
predictable
comments.author: Johnny Hernandez

comments.text:
hey john I defiantly recommend you to watch the movie! specially if you are 
Latino or Mexican, the movie its very predictable but it makes you realize 
how lucky you are, i might not know your situation in life , social level 
etc . but I was born in the USA but race in Mexico city,and you have no 
idea how lucky i feel to go tru what they did! its a great movie and i even 
cry!! its going to be worth it!

top_comment.text:
Saw Hundred Foot Journey in theater and enjoyed the "culture clash" movie. 
But that movie was more about the Indian family (Helen Mirren is just the 
foil), whereas this movie appears more about Costner's character. Not a big 
fan of Costner vehicles; will probably pass on this (in the theater at 
least).﻿

comments.text:
I think Costner is an excellent actor - very believable and this movie will 
be just as good if not better than the Hundred Foot Journey = which I 
really loved.  Kevin Costner is also easy on the eyes so if his character 
is the focus (which doesn't look like it to me) then I would still be happy 
seeing this movie.

captions.text: These kids working here are invisible.
an then they go back to the fields.
Mr White if we're gonna reach 'em now's the time.
I'm Coach White, your new PE teacher.
Popular name where you guys come from?
Not a popular name where you come from?
California is holding their first state championship this year.
You do understand we don't have a cross-country team?
You competed in High School, maybe?
Yeah, seven runners - not six runners and Danny Diaz!
You are a little fat, okay?
Just try and remember, lowest score wins.
We don't got a country club!
We don't even got a K-Mart.
I didn't know McFarland had a team.
Fourth place - it's not too shabby.
This is gonna come down to which runners
Mr White, each hour that my boys train with you they do not work with me.
No one stays in McFarland unless they have to.
There ain't nothin' American Dream about this place.
Guessin' running's the best thing you've got.
You are a good man, so I'm helping you.
The odds are stacked against us.
You are guys are super human.
There's nothing you can't do with that kind of strength.
Let's go show 'em how it's done.
Tell your father it was honor to be invited into his home.
Dad, he says it was an honor to be invited into your home.

title: McFarland USA Official Trailer + Trailer Review : Beyond The Trailer
